#summary Basic walkthrough of compiling and running a program that uses @NotNull

= Introduction =

This is a basic walkthrough of compiling and running a program that uses `@NotNull`.

= Writing and compiling the program =

Here is an example program that uses `@NotNull`:

{{{
package mypackage;

import notnullcheckweaver.NotNull;
import notnullcheckweaver.ArgumentNotNullCheckException;

@NotNull
public class MyProgram {

    private static void foo(Object object) {}
    
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        try {
            foo(null);
            System.out.println("It doesn't work :-(");
        } catch (ArgumentNotNullCheckException e) {
            System.out.println("It works! :-)");
        }
    }

}
}}}

Compile this program as follows:

<pre>
javac -classpath notnullcheckweaver.jar mypackage
</pre>

Run it as follows:

<pre>
java -javaagent:notnullcheckweaver.jar=mypackage mypackage.MyProgram
</pre>

You should get the following output:

<pre>
It works! :-)
</pre>
